name: Utah National Guard State Tuition Waiver
description: Eligible Utah National Guard members receive 100% tuition + fees waiver at Utah state public colleges and universities. Must be full-time Guard member. Apply through Utah National Guard Education Office.
benefit_amount: 100% tuition + fees waiver at Utah public institutions
how_to_apply: Apply through Utah National Guard Education Office (ng.ut.utarng.list.education-office@mail.mil)

name: State Tuition Assistance (STA)
description: Utah National Guard members receive up to $6,000 per state fiscal year (not exceeding $250/credit hour). STEM-C degree programs: up to $7,000/fiscal year. Can be used WITH federal TA AND GI Bill simultaneously to maximize benefits. Single unified application for all state/federal education benefits.
eligibility: Utah National Guard member (Army or Air)
Attending ANY Utah institution (public or private)
benefit_amount: Up to $6,000-$7,000 per state fiscal year (max $250/credit)
how_to_apply: Apply through Utah National Guard unified education application

name: Scott B. Lundell Tuition Waiver (Purple Heart/100% Disabled)
description: Children and un-remarried spouses of Utah veterans who received Purple Heart OR who died as result of service-connected disability OR are 100% service-connected disabled receive FREE tuition waiver at Utah public colleges/universities.
eligibility: Veteran received Purple Heart OR died from service-connected disability OR 100% disabled
benefit_amount: FREE tuition waiver at Utah public colleges/universities
how_to_apply: Apply through Utah System of Higher Education

name: Veterans Tuition Gap Program
description: Supplemental grant provided by State of Utah that covers tuition, fees, AND books for veterans whose federal GI Bill benefits have been exhausted or are not available. Attending Utah higher education institutions.
eligibility: Federal GI Bill benefits exhausted OR not available
Attending Utah institution of higher education
how_to_apply: Contact school admissions office
source_name: Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

name: In-State Tuition for Military and Veterans
description: In-state tuition available for: active duty assigned to Utah (including Guard/Reserve), immediate family of active duty in Utah, veterans with non-dishonorable discharge, family members of veteran claimed as dependent, eligible GI Bill users, Utah resident away on military duty taking online courses.
eligibility: Active duty in Utah OR family member OR
Veteran (not dishonorable) OR family of veteran OR
how_to_apply: Contact Admissions Office Residency page at Utah institution

name: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption (10%-100%)
description: Veterans with 10%-100% service-connected disability receive property tax exemption on primary residence (up to 1 acre) OR tangible personal property (vehicles, boats, etc.). 2025 maximum exemption: $521,620 taxable value. Actual benefit = disability % × maximum. Applies to unmarried surviving spouse or minor orphans. Apply by September 1 annually.
eligibility: Primary residence (1 acre max) OR personal property
benefit_amount: Up to $521,620 taxable value exemption (disability % × maximum, 2025)
how_to_apply: Apply to County Auditor/Treasurer by September 1 annually with VA letter

name: Active/Reserve Duty 200-Day Property Tax Exemption
description: Active or Reserve duty service members stationed OUTSIDE Utah for 200+ days in calendar year (or 200 consecutive days beginning prior year) receive TOTAL property tax exemption on primary residence. Must be property owner as of January 1. Reapply annually.
eligibility: Active or Reserve duty service member
benefit_amount: 100% property tax exemption on primary residence
how_to_apply: Apply to County Auditor/Treasurer by September 1 with military orders

name: Military Pay Income Tax (Follows Federal)
description: All income included in federal adjusted gross income is automatically included in Utah income. Income exempt from federal taxation is also exempt for Utah. Military pay for nonresident service members is NOT subject to Utah income tax.
how_to_apply: Include/exclude same as federal return

name: Survivor Benefits Tax Credit (SBP/RCSBP/RSFPP)
description: Surviving spouse or dependent child of service member who died on active duty OR in line of duty (inactive duty training) receive tax credit on survivor benefits. Tax credit = federally taxable benefits × 0.0485 (4.85%). Also applies to SBP, RCSBP, and RSFPP annuities.
eligibility: Service member died on active duty OR in line of duty
benefit_amount: Tax credit = 4.85% of federally taxable survivor benefits
how_to_apply: Claim credit on Utah income tax return

name: Military Disability Retirement Pay Exemption
description: Military Disability Retirement Pay received as pension, annuity, or similar allowance for personal injury or sickness resulting from active service is exempt from Utah state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military disability retirement pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from Utah income tax return

name: Military Spouse Occupational Licensing Reciprocity
description: Military spouses receive expedited processing for occupational licenses and credit for equivalent out-of-state licenses when moving to Utah with service member spouse.
eligibility: Moving to Utah with service member
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Department of Commerce, Division of Occupational and Professional Licensing

name: Veterans Job Preference (State Employment)
description: Honorably discharged veterans receive hiring preference for Utah state government positions. Disabled veterans receive additional consideration.
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications with DD-214

name: Disabled Veterans' Outreach Program (DVOP)
description: Specialized employment services through Utah Department of Workforce Services for disabled veterans including job placement assistance, career counseling, and training opportunities.
benefit_amount: FREE employment services and job placement assistance
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Department of Workforce Services

name: ACE Program (Accelerated Career Entry)
description: Designed to assist Utah veterans, Active Component members, actively drilling Guard/Reserve, and spouses overcome employment barriers. Provides avenue to gain civilian employment by capitalizing on military experience OR short-term training leading to certificate/license.
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs
source_name: Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

name: FREE Utah State Parks Admission
description: Utah veterans receive FREE admission to all Utah State Parks. Great for outdoor recreation in one of America's most beautiful states.
how_to_apply: Present veteran ID or DD-214 at Utah State Parks

name: Reduced Fare Cards (Bus/TRAX)
description: Utah veterans eligible for reduced fare cards on public transportation (bus and TRAX light rail) in Utah.
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Transit Authority (UTA)

name: Disabled Veteran License Plates
description: Veterans with ANY service-connected disability can receive Disabled Veteran license plate. One-time $15 fee, NO renewal fees. Must present Military ID or documentation AND VA Summary of Benefits letter. NOTE: Plate does NOT qualify for disabled parking.
how_to_apply: Apply at Utah DMV with VA Summary of Benefits letter

name: FREE Special Group License Plates (Purple Heart/POW/Pearl Harbor)
description: Purple Heart recipients, former POWs, and Pearl Harbor survivors receive license plates EXEMPT from application AND renewal fees. Regular registration fees and property taxes still apply. Present Purple Heart membership card, Pearl Harbor Survivors Association card, or DD-214.
benefit_amount: FREE application + FREE renewal (no plate fees)
how_to_apply: Apply at Utah DMV with qualifying documentation

name: Veteran Designation on Driver's License
description: Veterans can have 'UTAH HONORS VETERANS' veteran designation added to Utah driver's license. Must provide DD-214 showing honorable or general discharge. Verification typically takes 2-3 weeks after application.
how_to_apply: Submit DD-214 to Utah DMV for verification

name: Utah Veterans Homes (3 Locations)
description: Three Utah veterans homes: Central Utah Veterans Home (Payson), George E. Wahlen Ogden Veterans Home (Ogden), Southern Utah Veterans Home (Ivins). Provide long-term care, memory care, and skilled nursing for eligible veterans and spouses.
benefit_amount: Subsidized long-term care and skilled nursing
how_to_apply: Contact specific Utah Veterans Home
source_name: Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

name: Utah Veterans Memorial Park Cemetery
description: State veterans cemetery in Bluffdale (Salt Lake County). Eligibility same as federal VA cemeteries. FREE burial for eligible veterans and spouses.
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Veterans Memorial Park Cemetery
source_name: Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

name: Utah Veterans Legal Clinic
description: FREE legal assistance for Utah veterans through Utah Veterans Legal Clinic. Provides pro bono legal services for civil matters.
benefit_amount: FREE pro bono legal services (civil matters)
how_to_apply: Contact Utah Veterans Legal Clinic
source_name: Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

name: Free Use of Armories
description: Utah veterans organizations and groups may use National Guard armories for meetings and events at no charge, subject to availability and approval.
how_to_apply: Contact Utah National Guard for armory use requests
